change.changenote: Note: This regulation has been placed in the Regulations Point in Time collection. This regulation is not repealed.

section.sectiontext: The following are exempted from the requirement to obtain an energy removal certificate under section 15 of the Utilities Commission Act:

paragraph.paragraphtext: a petroleum product carried by a motor vehicle, aircraft, locomotive or ship in its tank or bunker for its own consumption;

a petroleum product being used for personal consumption while travelling out of the Province including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, lamp fuel, stove fuel and lubricating greases;
electricity flows resulting from an emergency experienced by a utility that is a member of the Western System Co-ordinating Council;

electricity being supplied to communities near British Columbia's border that, due to their isolation, can be more readily supplied by a utility in British Columbia than one in the jurisdiction in which the community is located;
electricity that leaves the Province as a result of the normal operating schedules of the Western System Co-ordinating Council;
a petroleum product resulting from manufacturing of crude oil or natural gas or refining of crude oil or a synthetic equivalent of crude oil.
